frameDefinitions: A Manner describes general or specific characteristics of an event in one of three ways:  First, it can refer to how a Comparison_event transpires, absent the influence of an entity (e.g. 'the way you talk').
An Entity is judged by a sound Attribute of some perceived level of Volume intensity.
These words describe the size of message that a Speaker is judged by a (usually unexpressed)
A Speaker realizes a Sign, usually a linguistic one, in some Formal_realization.
An event or state (here termed an Eventuality) or time-Period is described in terms of the Degree to which its duration diverges from a standard.
An Entity stands out perceptually in comparison to other members of its type.
frameExamples: He completed the task in a fervent <t>manner</t>.
Graham is very shy with most people, but he gets very <t>chatty</t> with Mr. Roberts.
A person doesn't always <t>pronounce</t> a word the way they say  it in context
After a <t>lengthy</t> discussion with the Foreign Minister, Mr. Qian Qichen, they met the Prime Minister.
Pilot Mountain in NC is very <t>prominent</t>.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Comparison_event</fen> is the principal event being characteriszed by the <fen>Manner</fen>. The <fen>Manner</fen> of this <fen>Comparison_event</fen> is often used in comparison with the <fen>Foreground_event</fen>.
The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> that is associated with or directly responsible for the <fen>Comparison_activity</fen>.
The description of the <fen>Comparison_event</fen> or <fen>Comparison_activity</fen>.
A description of the <fen>Manner</fen>.
The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> conducts or engages in the <fen>Comparison_activity</fen> that is being described.
The <fen>Entity</fen> for which the sound level <fen>Attribute</fen> is under consideration.
The feature of an <fen>Entity</fen> which is under consideration. This role is incorporated in each LU in the frame.
A quantity or characterization of the <fen>Entity</fen>'s sound output with repspect to its <fen>Attribute</fen>.
A modifier expressing the deviation of the <fen>Volume</fen> from the norm.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in the state of having  a particular <fen>Volume</fen> for the <fen>Attribute</fen>.
The place where an <fen>Entity</fen> is located.
This is the person who is characterized as talkative, reticent etc.  It is usually the External Argument:

<fen>Text</fen> is rarely expressed because the quantity of information given is the focus of the frame, rather than the information content. Texts can occur as NP objects, but cannot be either direct quotes or complement clauses.
This role is the <fen>Topic</fen> on which much or little information is communicated. <fen>Topic</fen> is far more frequent than Message in this frame.
The language user who produces a <fen>Sign</fen> in some modality.
An abstract form-meaning pairing.
An evaluation of whether the <fen>Formal_realization</fen> that the <fen>Speaker</fen> produced matches the standard or standard range.
The written string, gesture, or vocalized sound sequence that the <fen>Speaker</fen> produces.
A constituent part of the <fen>Formal_realization</fen>.
The way that the <fen>Speaker</fen> produces the <fen>Formal_realization</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Speaker</fen> produces the <fen>Formal_realization</fen>.

A situation, action or event whose duration is being described.  The Eventuality occurs as the External Argument if the adjective is used predicatively, or as the modified noun if the adjective is used attributively: <fex name='Eventuality'>The lecture</fex> was <t>short</t>. We had a <t>lengthy</t> <fex name='Eventuality'>conversation</fex>.

Sometimes these adjectives describe simply a period of time, rather than an event or state.  The Period almost invariably occurs as the modified noun with an attributive adjective: We waited for only a <t>short</t> <fex name='Period'>time</fex>. Use of the drug over a <t>lengthy</t> <fex name='Period'>period</fex> can cause memory loss.
The <fen>Entity</fen> for which the saliency <fen>Attribute</fen> is appropriate and under consideration.
The feature of the <fen>Entity</fen> which is under discussion, namely perceptual salience.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in the state of having  a particular salience.
This role refers to the location where the <fen>Entity</fen> has a prominence of some <fen>Attribute</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Pat</fex> has been silent on this issue.
Kim is very talkative <fex>about her family and childhood</fex>.
<fex>He</fex> insists on mispronouncing my name every time, the bastard!
Finally, I would pay more attention to your 'oppinion' if you spelled it <fex>correctly</fex>.
The old uncensored editions of the Talmud referred to Jesus as Yeshua censored versions spelled it <fex>as Yeshu</fex>
You spelled it <fex>the way it sounds</fex>.
If you are asked to search for the plus sign with red-vertical and green-horizontal elements, <fex>all the red and green plus signs</fex> may seem to become salient.
The diagram, (a frequency distribution chart) shows a <fex>prominently</fex> conspicuous region of stars that extend from the extremely bright and hot stars to the faint and cool variety.
The affection for American culture seemed more prominent <fex>last year</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the National Baseball Hall of Fame Library
Deadball Stars of the National League
